section.heading: National infrastructure project assistance

paragraph.heading: Department.—
paragraph.content: The term “Department” means the Department of Transportation.

paragraph.heading: Eligible entity.—
paragraph.chapeau: The term “eligible entity” means—

subparagraph.content: a State or a group of States;
a metropolitan planning organization;
a unit of local government;
a political subdivision of a State;
a special purpose district or public authority with a transportation function, including a port authority;
a Tribal government or a consortium of Tribal governments;
a partnership between Amtrak and 1 or more entities described in subparagraphs (A) through (F); and
a group of entities described in any of subparagraphs (A) through (G).

paragraph.heading: Program.—
paragraph.content: The term “program” means the program established by subsection (b).

paragraph.heading: Secretary.—
paragraph.content: The term “Secretary” means the Secretary of Transportation.

paragraph.heading: State.—
paragraph.chapeau: The term “State” means—

subparagraph.content: any of the several States;
the District of Columbia;
the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico;
the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands;
the United States Virgin Islands;
Guam;
American Samoa; and
any other territory or possession of the United States.

subsection.heading: Establishment.—
subsection.content: There is established a program under which the Secretary shall provide to eligible entities grants, on a competitive basis pursuant to single-year or multiyear grant agreements, for projects described in subsection (d).

paragraph.heading: In general.—
paragraph.content: To be eligible for a grant under the program, an eligible entity shall submit to the Secretary an application at such time, in such manner, and containing such information as the Secretary determines to be appropriate.

paragraph.heading: Plan for data collection.—
paragraph.content: An application under paragraph (1) shall include a plan for data collection and analysis described in subsection (g).

subsection.heading: Eligible Projects.—
subsection.chapeau: The Secretary may provide a grant under the program only for a project—

paragraph.chapeau: that is—

subparagraph.chapeau: a highway or bridge project carried out on—

clause.content: the National Multimodal Freight Network established under section 70103;
the National Highway Freight Network established under section 167 of title 23; or
the National Highway System (as defined in section 101(a) of title 23);

subparagraph.content: a freight intermodal (including public ports) or freight rail project that provides a public benefit;
a railway-highway grade separation or elimination project;
an intercity passenger rail project;

subparagraph.chapeau: a public transportation project that is—

clause.content: eligible for assistance under chapter 53; and
part of a project described in any of subparagraphs (A) through (D); or

subparagraph.content: a grouping, combination, or program of interrelated, connected, or dependent projects of any of the projects described in subparagraphs (A) through (E); and

paragraph.chapeau: the eligible project costs of which are—

subparagraph.content: reasonably anticipated to equal or exceed $500,000,000; or

subparagraph.chapeau: for any project funded by the set-aside under subsection (m)(2)—

clause.content: more than $100,000,000; but

subsection.heading: Geographical Distribution.—
subsection.chapeau: In providing grants under this section, the Secretary shall ensure among grant recipients—

paragraph.content: geographical diversity; and
a balance between rural and urban communities.

paragraph.heading: Requirements.—
paragraph.chapeau: The Secretary may select a project described in subsection (d) to receive a grant under the program only if the Secretary determines that—

subparagraph.content: the project is likely to generate national or regional economic, mobility, or safety benefits;
the project is in need of significant Federal funding;
the project will be cost-effective;

subparagraph.chapeau: with respect to related non-Federal financial commitments, 1 or more stable and dependable sources of funding and financing are available—

clause.content: to construct, operate, and maintain the project; and
to cover cost increases; and

subparagraph.content: the applicant has, or will have, sufficient legal, financial, and technical capacity to carry out the project.

paragraph.heading: Evaluation criteria.—
paragraph.chapeau: In awarding a grant under the program, the Secretary shall evaluate—

subparagraph.content: the extent to which a project supports achieving a state of good repair for each existing asset to be improved by the project;

subparagraph.chapeau: the level of benefits a project is expected to generate, including—

clause.content: the costs avoided by the prevention of closure or reduced use of the asset to be improved by the project;
reductions in maintenance costs over the life of the applicable asset;
safety benefits, including the reduction of serious injuries and fatalities and related costs;
improved person or freight throughput, including improved mobility and reliability; and

clause.chapeau: environmental benefits and health impacts, such as—

subclause.content: preventing stormwater runoff that would be a detriment to aquatic species; and

subparagraph.content: the benefits of the project, as compared to the costs of the project;
the number of persons or volume of freight, as applicable, supported by the project; and
national and regional economic benefits of the project, including with respect to short- and long-term job access, growth, or creation.

paragraph.heading: Additional considerations.—
paragraph.chapeau: In selecting projects to receive grants under the program, the Secretary shall take into consideration—

subparagraph.content: contributions to geographical diversity among grant recipients, including a balance between the needs of rural and urban communities;
whether multiple States would benefit from a project;

subparagraph.chapeau: whether, and the degree to which, a project uses—

clause.chapeau: construction materials or approaches that have—

subclause.content: demonstrated reductions in greenhouse gas emissions; or
reduced the need for maintenance of other projects; or

clause.content: technologies that will allow for future connectivity and automation;
a historically disadvantaged community or population; or
an area of persistent poverty;

subparagraph.chapeau: whether a project benefits users of multiple modes of transportation, including—

clause.content: pedestrians;
bicyclists; and
users of nonvehicular rail and public transportation, including intercity and commuter rail; and

subparagraph.content: whether a project improves connectivity between modes of transportation moving persons or goods nationally or regionally.

subparagraph.heading: In general.—
subparagraph.content: In evaluating applications for a grant under the program, the Secretary shall assign the project proposed in the application a rating described in subparagraph (B), based on the information contained in the applicable notice published under paragraph (5).

clause.heading: Highly recommended.—
clause.chapeau: The Secretary shall assign a rating of “highly recommended” to projects that, in the determination of the Secretary—

subclause.content: are exemplary projects of national or regional significance; and
would provide significant public benefit, as determined based on the applicable criteria described in this subsection, if funded under the program.

clause.heading: Recommended.—
clause.chapeau: The Secretary shall assign a rating of “recommended” to projects that, in the determination of the Secretary—

subclause.content: are of national or regional significance; and
would provide public benefit, as determined based on the applicable criteria described in this subsection, if funded under the program.

clause.heading: Not recommended.—
clause.content: The Secretary shall assign a rating of “not recommended” to projects that, in the determination of the Secretary, should not receive a grant under the program, based on the applicable criteria described in this subsection.

clause.heading: In general.—
clause.content: On request of an eligible entity that submitted an application under subsection (c) for a project that is not selected to receive a grant under the program, the Secretary shall provide to the eligible entity technical assistance and briefings relating to the project.

clause.heading: Treatment.—
clause.content: Technical assistance provided under this subparagraph shall not be considered a guarantee of future selection of the applicable project under the program.

paragraph.heading: Publication of project evaluation and selection criteria.—
paragraph.chapeau: Not later than 90 days after the date of enactment of this chapter, the Secretary shall publish and make publicly available on the website of the Department a notice that contains a detailed explanation of—

subparagraph.content: the method by which the Secretary will determine whether a project satisfies the applicable requirements described in paragraph (1);
any additional ratings the Secretary may assign to determine the means by which a project addresses the selection criteria and additional considerations described in paragraphs (2) and (3); and
the means by which the project requirements and ratings referred to in subparagraphs (A) and (B) will be used to assign an overall rating for the project under paragraph (4).

paragraph.heading: Project selection priority.—
paragraph.content: In awarding grants under the program, the Secretary shall give priority to projects to which the Secretary has assigned a rating of “highly recommended” under paragraph (4)(B)(i).

subparagraph.heading: In general.—
subparagraph.chapeau: An eligible entity seeking a grant under the program shall submit to the Secretary, together with the grant application, a plan for the collection and analysis of data to identify in accordance with the framework established under paragraph (2)—

clause.content: the impacts of the project; and
the accuracy of any forecast prepared during the development phase of the project and included in the grant application.

subparagraph.heading: Contents.—
subparagraph.chapeau: A plan under subparagraph (A) shall include—

subclause.content: the criteria described in subsection (f)(2); and
if applicable, the additional requirements described in subsection (f)(3);

clause.content: an approach for analyzing the consistency of predicted project characteristics with actual outcomes; and
any other elements that the Secretary determines to be necessary.

paragraph.heading: Framework.—
paragraph.chapeau: The Secretary may publish a standardized framework for the contents of the plans under paragraph (1), which may include, as appropriate—

subparagraph.content: standardized forecasting and measurement approaches;
data storage system requirements; and
any other requirements the Secretary determines to be necessary to carry out this section.

paragraph.heading: Multiyear grant agreements.—
paragraph.content: The Secretary shall require an eligible entity, as a condition of receiving funding pursuant to a multiyear grant agreement under the program, to collect additional data to measure the impacts of the project and to accurately track improvements made by the project, in accordance with a plan described in paragraph (1).

subparagraph.heading: Project baseline.—
subparagraph.content: Before the date of completion of a project for which a grant is provided under the program, the eligible entity carrying out the project shall submit to the Secretary a report providing baseline data for the purpose of analyzing the long-term impact of the project in accordance with the framework established under paragraph (2).

subparagraph.heading: Updated report.—
subparagraph.chapeau: Not later than 6 years after the date of completion of a project for which a grant is provided under the program, the eligible entity carrying out the project shall submit to the Secretary a report that compares the baseline data included in the report under subparagraph (A) to project data collected during the period—

clause.content: beginning on the date that is 5 years after the date of completion of the project; and
ending on the date on which the updated report is submitted.

paragraph.heading: In general.—
paragraph.chapeau: An eligible entity may use a grant provided under the program for—

subparagraph.content: development-phase activities and costs, including planning, feasibility analysis, revenue forecasting, alternatives analysis, data collection and analysis, environmental review and activities to support environmental review, preliminary engineering and design work, and other preconstruction activities, including the preparation of a data collection and post-construction analysis plan under subsection (g); and

construction, reconstruction, rehabilitation, acquisition of real property (including land relating to the project and improvements to that land), environmental mitigation (including projects to replace or rehabilitate culverts or reduce stormwater runoff for the purpose of improving habitat for aquatic species), construction contingencies, acquisition of equipment, protection, and operational improvements directly relating to the project.

paragraph.heading: Interest and other financing costs.—
paragraph.content: The interest and other financing costs of carrying out any part of a project under a multiyear grant agreement within a reasonable period of time shall be considered to be an eligible project cost only if the applicable eligible entity certifies to the Secretary that the eligible entity has demonstrated reasonable diligence in seeking the most favorable financing terms.

paragraph.heading: In general.—
paragraph.content: The total amount awarded for a project under the program may not exceed 60 percent of the total eligible project costs described in subsection (h).

subparagraph.heading: In general.—
subparagraph.content: Subject to subparagraph (B), Federal assistance other than a grant awarded under the program may be provided for a project for which a grant is awarded under the program.

subparagraph.heading: Limitation.—
subparagraph.content: The total amount of Federal assistance provided for a project for which a grant is awarded under the program shall not exceed 80 percent of the total cost of the project.

subparagraph.heading: Non-federal share.—
subparagraph.content: Secured loans or financing provided under section 603 of title 23 or section 22402 of this title and repaid with local funds or revenues shall be considered to be part of the local share of the cost of a project.

paragraph.heading: Application to multiyear agreements.—
paragraph.content: Notwithstanding any other provision of this title, in any case in which amounts are provided under the program pursuant to a multiyear agreement, the disbursed Federal share of the cost of the project may exceed the limitations described in paragraphs (1) and (2)(B) for 1 or more years if the total amount of the Federal share of the cost of the project, once completed, does not exceed those limitations.

paragraph.heading: In general.—
paragraph.content: A project for which an eligible entity receives a multiyear grant under the program shall be carried out in accordance with this subsection.

paragraph.heading: Terms.—
paragraph.chapeau: A multiyear grant agreement under this subsection shall—

subparagraph.content: establish the terms of Federal participation in the applicable project;
establish the maximum amount of Federal financial assistance for the project;
establish a schedule of anticipated Federal obligations for the project that provides for obligation of the full grant amount;
describe the period of time for completing the project, regardless of whether that period extends beyond the period of an authorization; and
facilitate timely and efficient management of the applicable project by the eligible entity carrying out the project, in accordance with applicable law.

subparagraph.heading: In general.—
subparagraph.chapeau: A multiyear grant agreement under this subsection—

clause.content: shall provide for the obligation of an amount of available budget authority specified in law;

may include a commitment, contingent on amounts to be specified in law in advance for commitments under this paragraph, to obligate an additional amount from future available budget authority specified in law; and

shall provide that any funds disbursed under the program for the project before the completion of any review required under the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 (42 U.S.C. 4321 et seq.) may only cover costs associated with development-phase activities described in subsection (h)(1)(A).

subparagraph.heading: Contingent commitment.—
subparagraph.content: A contingent commitment under this paragraph is not an obligation of the Federal Government, including for purposes of section 1501 of title 31.

paragraph.heading: Single-year grants.—
paragraph.content: The Secretary may only provide to an eligible entity a full grant under the program in a single year if all reviews required under the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 (42 U.S.C. 4321 et seq.) with respect to the applicable project have been completed before the receipt of any program funds.

paragraph.heading: In general.—
paragraph.chapeau: Not later than 30 days before the date on which the Secretary publishes the selection of projects to receive grants under the program, the Secretary shall submit to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate and the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives a written notice that includes—

subparagraph.content: a list of all project applications reviewed by the Secretary as part of the selection process;
the rating assigned to each project under subsection (f)(4);

subparagraph.chapeau: an evaluation and justification with respect to each project for which the Secretary will—

clause.content: provide a grant under the program; and
enter into a multiyear grant agreement under the program;

subparagraph.content: a description of the means by which the Secretary anticipates allocating among selected projects the amounts made available to the Secretary to carry out the program; and

anticipated funding levels required for the 3 fiscal years beginning after the date of submission of the notice for projects selected for grants under the program, based on information available to the Secretary as of that date.

paragraph.heading: Congressional disapproval.—
paragraph.content: The Secretary may not provide a grant or any other obligation or commitment to fund a project under the program if a joint resolution is enacted disapproving funding for the project before the last day of the 30-day period described in paragraph (1).

paragraph.heading: Transparency.—
paragraph.chapeau: Not later than 60 days after the date on which the grants are announced under the program, the Secretary shall publish on the website of the Department a report that includes—

subparagraph.content: a list of all project applications reviewed by the Secretary as part of the selection process under the program;
the rating assigned to each project under subsection (f)(4); and
a description of each project for which a grant has been provided under the program.

subparagraph.heading: Assessment.—
subparagraph.content: The Comptroller General of the United States shall conduct an assessment of the administrative establishment, solicitation, selection, and justification process with respect to the funding of grants under the program.

subparagraph.heading: Report.—
subparagraph.chapeau: Not later than 18 months after the date on which the initial grants are awarded for projects under the program, the Comptroller General shall submit to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate and the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives a report that describes, as applicable—

clause.content: the adequacy and fairness of the process by which the projects were selected; and
the justification and criteria used for the selection of the projects.

paragraph.heading: In general.—
paragraph.content: There is authorized to be appropriated to the Secretary to carry out the program $2,000,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2022 through 2026.

paragraph.heading: Other projects.—
paragraph.chapeau: Of the amounts made available under paragraph (1), 50 percent shall be set aside for projects that have a project cost of—

subparagraph.content: more than $100,000,000; but

paragraph.heading: Administrative expenses.—
paragraph.chapeau: Of the amounts made available to carry out the program for each fiscal year, the Secretary may reserve not more than 2 percent for the costs of—

subparagraph.content: administering and overseeing the program; and
hiring personnel for the program, including personnel dedicated to processing permitting and environmental review issues.

paragraph.heading: Transfer of authority.—
paragraph.content: The Secretary may transfer any portion of the amounts reserved under paragraph (3) for a fiscal year to the Administrator of any of the Federal Highway Administration, the Federal Transit Administration, the Federal Railroad Administration, or the Maritime Administration to award and oversee grants in accordance with this section.

paragraph.heading: In general.—
paragraph.chapeau: Each project that receives a grant under this chapter shall achieve compliance with the applicable requirements of—

subparagraph.content: subchapter IV of chapter 31 of title 40;
title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 (42 U.S.C. 2000d et seq.); and
the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 (42 U.S.C. 4321 et seq.).

paragraph.heading: Modal requirements.—
paragraph.chapeau: The Secretary shall, with respect to a project funded by a grant under this section, apply—

subparagraph.content: the requirements of title 23 to a highway, road, or bridge project;
the requirements of chapter 53 to a transit project; and
the requirements of section 22905 to a rail project.

subparagraph.heading: In general.—
subparagraph.chapeau: Except as otherwise provided in this paragraph, if an eligible project is a multimodal project, the Secretary shall—

clause.content: determine the predominant modal component of the project; and
apply the applicable requirements described in paragraph (2) of the predominant modal component to the project.

clause.heading: Passenger or freight rail component.—
clause.content: The requirements of section 22905 shall apply to any passenger or freight rail component of a project.

clause.heading: Public transportation component.—
clause.content: The requirements of section 5333 shall apply to any public transportation component of a project.

section.sourceCredit: (Added Pub. L. 117–58, div. B, title I, § 21201, Nov. 15, 2021, 135 Stat. 663.)

paragraph.heading: Area of persistent poverty.—
paragraph.chapeau: The term “area of persistent poverty” means—

subparagraph.chapeau: any county (or equivalent jurisdiction) in which, during the 30-year period ending on the date of enactment of this chapter, 20 percent or more of the population continually lived in poverty, as measured by—

clause.content: the 1990 decennial census;
the 2000 decennial census; and
the most recent annual small area income and poverty estimate of the Bureau of the Census;

subparagraph.content: any census tract with a poverty rate of not less than 20 percent, as measured by the 5-year data series available from the American Community Survey of the Bureau of the Census for the period of 2014 through 2018; and
any territory or possession of the United States.

paragraph.heading: Eligible entity.—
paragraph.chapeau: The term “eligible entity” means—

subparagraph.content: a State;
the District of Columbia;
any territory or possession of the United States;
a unit of local government;
a public agency or publicly chartered authority established by 1 or more States;
a special purpose district or public authority with a transportation function, including a port authority;
a federally recognized Indian Tribe or a consortium of such Indian Tribes;
a transit agency; and
a multi-State or multijurisdictional group of entities described in any of subparagraphs (A) through (H).

paragraph.heading: Eligible project.—
paragraph.chapeau: The term “eligible project” means—

subparagraph.content: a highway or bridge project eligible for assistance under title 23;
a public transportation project eligible for assistance under chapter 53;
a passenger rail or freight rail transportation project eligible for assistance under this title;

clause.content: inland port infrastructure; and
a land port-of-entry;

subparagraph.content: the surface transportation components of an airport project eligible for assistance under part B of subtitle VII;
a project for investment in a surface transportation facility located on Tribal land, the title or maintenance responsibility of which is vested in the Federal Government;

a project to replace or rehabilitate a culvert or prevent stormwater runoff for the purpose of improving habitat for aquatic species that will advance the goal of the program described in subsection (b)(2); and
any other surface transportation infrastructure project that the Secretary considers to be necessary to advance the goal of the program.

paragraph.heading: Program.—
paragraph.content: The term “program” means the Local and Regional Project Assistance Program established under subsection (b)(1).

paragraph.heading: Rural area.—
paragraph.content: The term “rural area” means an area that is located outside of an urbanized area.

paragraph.heading: Secretary.—
paragraph.content: The term “Secretary” means the Secretary of Transportation.

paragraph.heading: Urbanized area.—
paragraph.content: The term “urbanized area” means an area with a population of more than 200,000 residents, based on the most recent decennial census.

paragraph.heading: In general.—
paragraph.content: The Secretary shall establish and carry out a program, to be known as the “Local and Regional Project Assistance Program”, to provide for capital investments in surface transportation infrastructure.

paragraph.heading: Goal.—
paragraph.content: The goal of the program shall be to fund eligible projects that will have a significant local or regional impact and improve transportation infrastructure.

paragraph.heading: In general.—
paragraph.content: In carrying out the program, the Secretary may make grants to eligible entities, on a competitive basis, in accordance with this section.

paragraph.heading: Amount.—
paragraph.chapeau: Except as otherwise provided in this section, each grant made under the program shall be in an amount equal to—

subparagraph.content: not less than $5,000,000 for an urbanized area;
not less than $1,000,000 for a rural area; and
not more than $25,000,000.

paragraph.heading: Limitation.—
paragraph.content: Not more than 15 percent of the funds made available to carry out the program for a fiscal year may be awarded to eligible projects in a single State during that fiscal year.

paragraph.heading: Notice of funding opportunity.—
paragraph.content: Not later than 60 days after the date on which funds are made available to carry out the program, the Secretary shall publish a notice of funding opportunity for the funds.

paragraph.heading: Applications.—
paragraph.chapeau: To be eligible to receive a grant under the program, an eligible entity shall submit to the Secretary an application—

subparagraph.content: in such form and containing such information as the Secretary considers to be appropriate; and
by such date as the Secretary may establish, subject to the condition that the date shall be not later than 90 days after the date on which the Secretary issues the solicitation under paragraph (1).

paragraph.heading: Primary selection criteria.—
paragraph.chapeau: In awarding grants under the program, the Secretary shall evaluate the extent to which a project—

subparagraph.content: improves safety;
improves environmental sustainability;
improves the quality of life of rural areas or urbanized areas;
increases economic competitiveness and opportunity, including increasing tourism opportunities;
contributes to a state of good repair; and
improves mobility and community connectivity.

paragraph.heading: Additional selection criteria.—
paragraph.chapeau: In selecting projects to receive grants under the program, the Secretary shall take into consideration the extent to which—

subparagraph.content: the project sponsors collaborated with other public and private entities;

subparagraph.chapeau: the project adopts innovative technologies or techniques, including—

clause.content: innovative technology;
innovative project delivery techniques; and
innovative project financing;

subparagraph.content: the project has demonstrated readiness; and
the project is cost effective.

subparagraph.heading: In general.—
subparagraph.content: The Secretary, shall evaluate, through a methodology that is discernible and transparent to the public, the means by which each application submitted under paragraph (2) addresses the criteria under paragraphs (3) and (4) or otherwise established by the Secretary.

subparagraph.heading: Publication.—
subparagraph.content: The methodology under subparagraph (A) shall be published by the Secretary as part of the notice of funding opportunity under the program.

paragraph.heading: Awards.—
paragraph.content: Not later than 270 days after the date on which amounts are made available to provide grants under the program for a fiscal year, the Secretary shall announce the selection by the Secretary of eligible projects to receive the grants in accordance with this section.

subparagraph.heading: In general.—
subparagraph.content: On request of an eligible entity that submitted an application under paragraph (2) for a project that is not selected to receive a grant under the program, the Secretary shall provide to the eligible entity technical assistance and briefings relating to the project.

subparagraph.heading: Treatment.—
subparagraph.content: Technical assistance provided under this paragraph shall not be considered a guarantee of future selection of the applicable project under the program.

paragraph.heading: In general.—
paragraph.content: Except as provided in paragraph (2), the Federal share of the cost of an eligible project carried out using a grant provided under the program shall not exceed 80 percent.

paragraph.heading: Exception.—
paragraph.content: The Federal share of the cost of an eligible project carried out in a rural area, a historically disadvantaged community, or an area of persistent poverty using a grant under this subsection may exceed 80 percent, at the discretion of the Secretary.

paragraph.heading: Treatment of other federal funds.—
paragraph.chapeau: Amounts provided under any of the following programs shall be considered to be a part of the non-Federal share for purposes of this subsection:

subparagraph.content: The tribal transportation program under section 202 of title 23.
The Federal lands transportation program under section 203 of title 23.
The TIFIA program (as defined in section 601(a) of title 23).
The Railroad Rehabilitation and Improvement Financing Program under chapter 224.

paragraph.heading: In general.—
paragraph.chapeau: Of the total amount made available to carry out the program for each fiscal year—

subparagraph.content: not more than 50 percent shall be allocated for eligible projects located in rural areas; and
not more than 50 percent shall be allocated for eligible projects located in urbanized areas.

paragraph.heading: Historically disadvantaged communities and areas of persistent poverty.—
paragraph.content: Of the total amount made available to carry out the program for each fiscal year, not less than 1 percent shall be awarded for projects in historically disadvantaged communities or areas of persistent poverty.

paragraph.heading: Multimodal and geographical considerations.—
paragraph.content: In selecting projects to receive grants under the program, the Secretary shall take into consideration geographical and modal diversity.

paragraph.heading: In general.—
paragraph.content: Of the amounts made available to carry out the program for each fiscal year, not less than 5 percent shall be made available for the planning, preparation, or design of eligible projects.

paragraph.heading: Nonapplicability of certain limitations.—
paragraph.content: Subparagraphs (A) and (B) of subsection (c)(2) shall not apply with respect to amounts made available for planning, preparation, or design under paragraph (1).

subsection.heading: Transfer of Authority.—
subsection.content: Of the amounts made available to carry out the program for each fiscal year, the Secretary may transfer not more than 2 percent for a fiscal year to the Administrator of any of the Federal Highway Administration, the Federal Transit Administration, the Federal Railroad Administration, or the Maritime Administration to award and oversee grants and credit assistance in accordance with this section.

paragraph.heading: In general.—
paragraph.chapeau: Subject to paragraph (2), at the request of an eligible entity, the Secretary may use a grant provided to the eligible entity under the program to pay the subsidy or credit risk premium, and the administrative costs, of an eligible project that is eligible for Federal credit assistance under—

subparagraph.content: chapter 224; or
chapter 6 of title 23.

paragraph.heading: Limitation.—
paragraph.content: Not more than 20 percent of the funds made available to carry out the program for a fiscal year may be used to carry out paragraph (1).

subsection.heading: Authorization of Appropriations.—
subsection.content: There is authorized to be appropriated to carry out this section $1,500,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2022 through 2026, to remain available for a period of 3 fiscal years following the fiscal year for which the amounts are appropriated.

paragraph.heading: Annual report.—
paragraph.content: The Secretary shall make available on the website of the Department of Transportation at the end of each fiscal year an annual report that describes each eligible project for which a grant was provided under the program during that fiscal year.

paragraph.heading: Comptroller general.—
paragraph.chapeau: Not later than 1 year after the date on which the initial grants are awarded for eligible projects under the program, the Comptroller General of the United States shall—

subparagraph.chapeau: review the administration of the program, including—

clause.content: the solicitation process; and

subclause.content: the adequacy and fairness of the process; and

subparagraph.content: submit to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate and the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives a report describing the findings of the review under subparagraph (A), including recommendations for improving the administration of the program, if any.

section.heading: National culvert removal, replacement, and restoration grant program

paragraph.heading: Director.—
paragraph.content: The term “Director” means the Director of the United States Fish and Wildlife Service.

paragraph.heading: Indian tribe.—
paragraph.content: The term “Indian Tribe” has the meaning given the term in section 4 of the Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act (25 U.S.C. 5304).

paragraph.heading: Program.—
paragraph.content: The term “program” means the annual competitive grant program established under subsection (b).

paragraph.heading: Secretary.—
paragraph.content: The term “Secretary” means the Secretary of Transportation.

paragraph.heading: Undersecretary.—
paragraph.content: The term “Undersecretary” means the Undersecretary of Commerce for Oceans and Atmosphere.

subsection.heading: Establishment.—
subsection.chapeau: The Secretary, in consultation with the Undersecretary, shall establish an annual competitive grant program to award grants to eligible entities for projects for the replacement, removal, and repair of culverts or weirs that—

paragraph.content: would meaningfully improve or restore fish passage for anadromous fish; and

paragraph.chapeau: with respect to weirs, may include—

subparagraph.content: infrastructure to facilitate fish passage around or over the weir; and
weir improvements.

subsection.heading: Eligible Entities.—
subsection.chapeau: An entity eligible to receive a grant under the program is—

paragraph.content: a State;
a unit of local government; or
an Indian Tribe.

subsection.heading: Grant Selection Process.—
subsection.content: The Secretary, in consultation with the Undersecretary and the Director, shall establish a process for determining criteria for awarding grants under the program, subject to subsection (e).

subsection.heading: Prioritization.—
subsection.chapeau: The Secretary, in consultation with the Undersecretary and the Director, shall establish procedures to prioritize awarding grants under the program to—

paragraph.chapeau: projects that would improve fish passage for—

subparagraph.content: anadromous fish stocks listed as an endangered species or a threatened species under section 4 of the Endangered Species Act of 1973 (16 U.S.C. 1533);
anadromous fish stocks identified by the Undersecretary or the Director that could reasonably become listed as an endangered species or a threatened species under that section;
anadromous fish stocks identified by the Undersecretary or the Director as prey for endangered species, threatened species, or protected species, including Southern resident orcas (Orcinus orcas); or
anadromous fish stocks identified by the Undersecretary or the Director as climate resilient stocks; and

paragraph.content: projects that would open up more than 200 meters of upstream habitat before the end of the natural habitat.

subsection.heading: Federal Share.—
subsection.content: The Federal share of the cost of a project carried out with a grant to a State or a unit of local government under the program shall be not more than 80 percent.

subsection.heading: Technical Assistance.—
subsection.content: The Secretary, in consultation with the Undersecretary and the Director, shall develop a process to provide technical assistance to Indian Tribes and underserved communities to assist in the project design and grant process and procedures.

subsection.heading: Administrative Expenses.—
subsection.content: Of the amounts made available for each fiscal year to carry out the program, the Secretary, the Undersecretary, and the Director may use not more than 2 percent to pay the administrative expenses necessary to carry out this section.

subsection.heading: Authorization of Appropriations.—
subsection.content: There is authorized to be appropriated to carry out the program $800,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2022 through 2026.
